slides.title: Docker Architecture
slides.caption: Docker container architecture overview
slides.content:
Container Technology

Docker revolutionized application deployment by containerizing applications with their dependencies. Each container runs in isolation while sharing the host operating system kernel.

  • Lightweight and fast startup
  • Consistent across environments
  • Easy version control with images
  • Microservices architecture enabler

slides.title: Kubernetes Cluster
slides.caption: Kubernetes orchestration platform
slides.content:
Container Orchestration

Kubernetes automates deployment, scaling, and management of containerized applications across clusters of hosts.

  • Automatic scaling and load balancing
  • Self-healing capabilities
  • Rolling updates and rollbacks
  • Service discovery and networking

slides.question: What does REST stand for in web API design?
slides.explanation: REST stands for Representational State Transfer. It is an architectural style for designing networked applications, relying on stateless, client-server communication using standard HTTP methods.

slides.question: Which data structure operates on LIFO (Last In, First Out) principle?
slides.explanation: A Stack operates on the LIFO principle where the last element added is the first one to be removed. This is useful for function call stacks, undo mechanisms, and expression evaluation.

slides.question: What is the time complexity of binary search in a sorted array?
slides.explanation: Binary search has O(log n) time complexity because it divides the search space in half with each iteration. For an array of 1000 elements, it requires at most 10 comparisons (2^10 = 1024).
